Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Carotid Artery Stenting Using Roadsaver Stent

Participants.evidence: 298 CAS procedures in 287 non-consecutive patients (203 men, mean age 70.5 ±8.6 years) with symptomatic or high-risk extracranial carotid artery stenosis.

Intervention.evidence: evaluates the safety and effectiveness of the Roadsaver double-nitinol-layer-micromesh stent in CAS.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the safety and effectiveness of the Roadsaver double-nitinol-layer-micromesh stent in CAS.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Clinical and neurological examinations and duplex ultrasound were conducted before CAS, before discharge, at 1, 6, and 12 months, then annually.

Result_Outcome.evidence: All CAS procedures were successful, reducing carotid stenosis from 84.9 ±9.9% to 11.0 ±9.4% (p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: In-hospital, 1 major (0.3%) and 3 minor (1.34%) ischemic strokes occurred, with 2 (0.7%) deaths due to cerebral hemorrhage.
